definition: to rein in/to compel/to force/to carve/to engrave/(literary) to command/to lead/bridle/(physics) abbr. for 勒克斯[le4 ke4 si1], lux
tight/strict/close at hand/near/urgent/tense/hard up/short of money/to tighten
to tighten one's belt/to live more frugally

sentences.english: He steadied the horse with a tight rein.
I get to tighten my belt that month.
sentences.chinese: 这个月我不可不勒紧裤腰带过生活。

sentences.english: Strangles the soul of a target enemy unit and extracts bits and pieces of it.
sentences.chinese: 勒紧一个敌方单位的灵魂，将他压榨出来。

sentences.english: If food is scarce it's no use complaining; we shall just have to pull in our belts.
sentences.chinese: 如果食品不足，抱怨也无用，我们将只得勒紧裤带。

sentences.english: In days like these, we must tighten our belts and be team players.
sentences.chinese: 在这个特殊时期，我们必须要勒紧裤带并团结协作。

sentences.english: When the food ran out we had to pull in our belt.
sentences.chinese: 没有食物时，我们必须勒紧裤带过日子。

sentences.english: Do you feel the straps cutting into your shoulders?
sentences.chinese: 感觉到背包带深深地勒紧你的肩膀吗？

sentences.english: Families are tightening their belts and so should Washington.
sentences.chinese: 许多家庭都在勒紧裤带，华盛顿也应该如此。

sentences.english: We all have to tighten our belts until your father finds another job.
sentences.chinese: 在你父亲找到另一份工作之前，我们都要勒紧裤带。

sentences.english: Has the combination — tighten belts and raise prices — worked?
sentences.chinese: 勒紧裤带和提高工资这两项能共同存在吗？
今天撑破肚，明天勒紧裤。

sentences.english: Rounding the shoulders too far forward tends to tighten the chestand restrict breathing.
sentences.chinese: 弄圆的肩膀向前太远会造成勒紧胸部和限制呼吸。

sentences.english: Jack took a steady hold of the reins, pressed his knees to the horse, and galloped off.
sentences.chinese: 朱瓦宁用双膝夹住马肚子，勒紧缰绳，放马奔驰起来。

sentences.english: We've got to tighten our belts.

definition: to tighten one's belt/to live more frugally
to economize on clothes and food/to scrimp and save (idiom)
tight/strict/close at hand/near/urgent/tense/hard up/short of money/to tighten
to save on food and clothing (idiom); to live frugally
tight (i.e. lacking money)/hard up/same as 緊巴巴|紧巴巴
lit. to bite the teeth tightly (idiom); fig. to grit one's teeth and bear the pain/to bite the bullet
to tie/bind or fasten together/to kidnap
